Description:
DLP/Virus/Webfilter: User agent - eg. agent="Mozilla/5.0"

WAF: Agent
The checksum of the file submitted for analytics
The trigger patterns and the packet data with base64 encoding

APP-CTRL/IPS/Webfilter: Authentication server for the user

DLP/WAF: Authentication Server

Virus: Server used to authenticate the involved user

DNS: DNS category ID

Webfilter: Web category ID

DNS: DNS category description

Webfilter: Web category description

Type of Channel:
 x11, shell, exec, tcp-fprward, tun-forward, sftp. scp
The checksum of the scanned file
User login ID detected by the Deep Application Control feature
Content Disarm action- eg. disarmed, detected

APP-CTRL/Anomaly/Webfilter: Client Reputation Action

IPS: Action performed by Threat Weight

Virus: Threat Weight action

APP-CTRL/Anomaly/IPS/Webfilter: Client Reputation level

Virus: Threat Weight Level

APP-CTRL/Anomaly/IPS/Webfilter: Client Reputation Score

Virus: Threat Weight Score

APP-CTRL/Anomaly/DLP/DNS/IPS/SSH/Virus/WAF/Webfilter: Date

VoIP: Day, month, and year when the log message was recorded.

APP-CTRL/Anomaly/IPS: Deivce ID

DLP/DNS/SSH/WAF/Webfilter: Device ID

VoIP: Serial number of the device for the traffic's origin.

APP-CTRL: Direction of the packets

DLP: Direction of packets

IPS/Virus: Message/packets direction

SSH: Direction of session

WAF: Direction

Webfilter: Direction of the web traffic

APP-CTRL/Anomaly/DLP/IPS/SSH/Virus/WAF/Webfilter: Destination Interface's assigned role (LAN, WAN, etc.)

DNS: Destination Interface Role

APP-CTRL/Anomaly/DLP/DNS/IPS/SSH/VoIP/Webfilter: Destination IP

Virus/WAF: Destination IP Address
Duration of the session. Ex: 180 (in seconds)

DLP: Epoch used for locating file

VoIP: Epoch

DNS: DNS filter service error message

Webfilter: URL rating error message

DLP: The serial number of the dlparchive file in the same epoch

WAF: Event ID

APP-CTRL/SSH: Event Time

Anomaly/IPS/Virus: Time when detection occured

DLP: Event Time, time when DLP event detected.

DNS: Event Timestamp

VoIP: Time when event occured

WAF: Event Time, Time when WAF event detected

Webfilter: Web Filter event time

APP-CTRL: App Control Event Type

Anomaly/SSH/WAF: Event Type

DLP: DLP event type

DNS: DNS Type (DNS query/DNS response)

IPS: IPS Event Type

Virus: Event type of AV

Webfilter: Web Filter event type
Mail Exchanges from DNS response answer section

APP-CTRL/DLP/Virus: Forticlient user ID

Anomaly/IPS/SSH/WAF/Webfilter: FortiClient UID

DNS: FortiClient ID
The filter used to identify the affected file
Used by Outbreak Prevention External Hash: the hash signature used in the detection
Used by Outbreak Prevention External Hash: external source that provided the hash signature

DLP: DLP filter type

Webfilter: Filter type

APP-CTRL/DLP: Forwarded For

IPS/Webfilter: X-Forwarded-For HTTP header

DLP/Virus: Email address from the Email Headers (IMAP/POP3/SMTP)

VoIP: Where call was originated from

Webfilter: MMS-only - From/To headers from the email
FortiSandbox Verdict returned to FortiGate after analysis (clean, low risk, med risk, high risk, malicious)

APP-CTRL/Anomaly/DLP/DNS/IPS/WAF/Webfilter: User group name

SSH: Group name for authentication

Virus: Group name (authentication)
The host name of a URL

Anomaly: ICMP code

IPS: Destination Port of the ICMP message

Anomaly: ICMP ID

IPS: Source port of the ICMP message

Anomaly: ICMP Type

IPS: The type of ICMP message
IP addresses from DNS response answer section
Kind of service. Typically it will have value "call"

APP-CTRL/Anomaly/DLP/DNS/IPS/SSH/Virus/WAF/Webfilter: Log ID

VoIP: Unique Log ID

APP-CTRL/Anomaly/DNS/Virus/WAF/Webfilter: Log message

IPS: Log message for the attack
Name of the firewall policy governing the traffic which caused the log message.

DLP: DLP profile name

DNS: Profile name for DNS filter

IPS: Profile name for IPS

SSH/WAF: Full profile name

Virus: The name of the profile that was used to detect and take action

VoIP: Name or number of associated VOIP profile

Webfilter: Web Filter profile name

APP-CTRL/DLP/DNS/IPS/SSH/Virus/Webfilter: Protocol number

Anomaly/WAF: Protocol

VoIP: Protocol number. Ex: for SIP it will be proto=17
Maximum quota allowed - in seconds if time-based - in bytes if traffic-based
Quota used - in seconds if time-based - in bytes if traffic-based

APP-CTRL/IPS/Webfilter: Extended logging data including HTTP method, URL, client content type, server content type, user agent, referer, x-forwarded-for

DLP/WAF: Raw Data
Email addresses from the SMTP envelope

Anomaly: Reference

IPS: URL of the FortiGuard IPS database entry for the attack.

Virus: The URL of the FortiGuard IPS database entry for the attack
Name of request. Ex: request_name="INVITE" or "NOTIFY"
Email address from the SMTP envelope

APP-CTRL/DLP/IPS/WAF/Webfilter: Service name

Anomaly: Name of Service

Virus: Proxy service which scanned this traffic

Anomaly/WAF: Severity

DLP: Severity level of a DLP rule

IPS: Severity of the attack

SSH: Severity level of shell command
Name of the source interface. Ex: src_int="port1"
Port number of the traffic's origin. Ex: srcport=40772

APP-CTRL/Anomaly/DLP/IPS/SSH/Virus/WAF/Webfilter: Source Interface's assigned role (LAN, WAN, etc.)

DNS: Source Interface Role

APP-CTRL/Anomaly/DLP/DNS/IPS/SSH/Webfilter: Source IP

Virus/WAF: Source IP Address

VoIP: IP address of the traffic's origin. Ex: srcip=10.1.100.155
MAC address associated with the Source IP
The subject title of the email message

APP-CTRL/Anomaly/DLP/DNS/IPS/SSH/WAF/Webfilter: Log subtype

Virus: Subtype of the virus log

VoIP: Subtype

APP-CTRL/Anomaly/DLP/DNS/IPS/SSH/Virus/WAF/Webfilter: Time

VoIP: Hour clock when the log message was recorded.

DLP/Virus: Email address(es) from the Email Headers (IMAP/POP3/SMTP)

VoIP: Destination address

Webfilter: MMS-only - From/To headers from the email

APP-CTRL: True-Client-IP

DLP: True client's IP

IPS/Webfilter: True-Client-IP HTTP header

APP-CTRL/Anomaly/DLP/DNS/IPS/SSH/Virus/WAF/Webfilter: Log type

VoIP: Type of log. Ex: type="utm"

APP-CTRL/DLP/IPS/Virus/Webfilter: The URL address

WAF: URL

APP-CTRL/DLP/DNS/IPS/WAF/Webfilter: User name

Anomaly: User

SSH: User name for authentication

Virus: Username (authentication)

APP-CTRL/Anomaly/DLP/DNS/IPS/SSH/WAF/Webfilter: Virtual domain name

Virus: VDOM name

VoIP: Name of the virtual domain in which the log message was recorded.

APP-CTRL/DLP: Virtual Routing Forwarding

Anomaly/IPS/Webfilter: Virtual router forwarding
